title: Daevid Allen & Kevin Ayers-University Of Errors (2002-08-18)
description:
University of Errors
with Daevid Allen, Kevin Ayers & Richard Sinclair
Progman Cometh Festival
Moore Theater
Seattle, WA USA
August 18, 2002

SOURCE: Audience

LINEAGE: Core Sound Stealth Cardoids > Sony PCM-M1 DAT > Philips CDR 870 >
         EAC > WAV > Nero Wave Editor (fades) > CD Wave (track splitting) > FLAC


1. Intro
2. Hope For Happiness
3. Wage Slave
4. Money Doesn't Make It
5. Rich Men Eat My Voice
6. So What
7. Mystico Fanatico
8. (transition / string change)
9. PHP 2032
10. 21st Century Schizoid Man
11. Why Are We Sleeping
12. Clarence In Wonderland

+ Kevin Ayers
13. Kevin Ayers Intro
14. The Unfairground (New Song)
15. Hymn
16. Feelin' Reelin' Squealin'
17. Star

+ Richard Sinclair
18. O Caroline
 
This is an excellent audience recording of a unique performance.

The Progman Cometh Festival was simultaneously the most wonderful and the most
weird concert going experience that I have ever had. Wonderful because I am a big
fan of Canterbury music and I never expected to see such a fantastic assembly of
musicians (Richard Sinclair, Phil Miller, Pip Pyle, Allan Holdworth, Hugh Hopper,
Elton Dean, John Marshall, Kevin Ayers, Daevid Allen, etc.) perform in various
configurations over a weekend. Weird because there was no more than 75 people
in attendance even though the hall could hold 1000. The festival was poorly
promoted and I was lucky to hear about it through a friend. In any case,
it was a tremendous weekend of music
